did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: George Creel Miscellaneous Papers

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: Hoover Institution on War, Revolution, and Peace

did.abstract: Correspondence, pamphlets, bulletins, clippings, and photographs, relating to American propaganda activities during World War I, and to the Golden Gate International Exposition. Includes publications of the Committee on Public Information. Also includes some papers of Winifred Gay, niece of George Creel, relating to her uncle.
did.langmaterial: Languages represented in the collection: English

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], George Creel Miscellaneous Papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The collection was acquired by the Hoover Instituion in 1948.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog Socrates at http://library.stanford.edu/webcat. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in Socrates is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

chronitem.event: Author, How We Advertised America, and The War, The World and Wilson
Author, Sam Houston, Colossus in Buckskin
Chairman, San Francisco Regional Labor Board
Chairman, National Advisory Board, Works Progress Administration
U.S. Commissioner, Golden Gate International Exposition
Author, Rebel at Large: Recollections of Fifty Crowded Years

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: The George Creel Miscellaneous Papers, acquired in 1988 and 1994, consist of correspondence, pamphlets, bulletins, clippings, and photographs, relating to American propaganda activities during World War I, and to the Golden Gate International Exposition. Also included are publications of the Committee on Public Information, and papers of Winifred Gay, niece of George Creel, relating to her uncle.

The bulk of the material relates to the Committee on Public Information and consists of George Creel's personal copies of its publications. The Photographs provide a glimpse into his personal life and focus on his tenure as U.S. commissioner, Golden Gate International Exposition. The Speeches and Writings represent only a fragment of Creel's prolific output.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is organized into five series: Personal and Family File, Speeches and Writings, United States Committee on Public Information Publications, Photographs, and Memorabilia.

controlaccess.head: Indexing Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the library's online public access catalog.

did.unittitle: Victory Dinner and Dance of the Division of Pictorial Publicity,

scopecontent.p: Contains a history of the division's work, a chart showing the number of poster designs produced for government and private agencies, a list of poster artists, and reproductions of selected posters with names of artists

did.unittitle: Photographs,

scopecontent.p: 89 prints and 11 negatives depicting George Creel, his family, and personalities such as Frank J. Hennessy, J. Edgar Hoover, W. R. Lawson, Frank Murphy, Franklin D. Roosevelt, and others

did.unittitle: 14 prints depicting George Creel and Blanche Bates Creel,
1 print depicting George Creel's mother with two other ladies and his white bull terrier, Kansas City, Missouri,
1 print depicting Hal and Nell(?) Creel, Staten Island,
4 prints depicting George Creel, including 1 with his dog,
1 print depicting George Creel with Frank J. Hennessy and others,
2 prints depicting George Creel and others on the occasion of the groundbreaking ceremony of the Federal Theater Building, Treasure Island, San Francisco,
3 prints, including 2 depicting George Creel and 1 print of his poem, "A Prayer," illustrated by Malcolm Strauss,
1 print depicting an unidentified building,
1 print of unidentified individuals at the beach,
3 prints, including 2 depicting George Creel on a camel's back in Khartoum, Sudan, and 1 depicting him standing next to a big stone,
1 print depicting George Creel,
7 prints depicting George Creel's family(?), San Francisco,
5 prints depicting George Creel,
1 print depicting George Creel with Alice May Rosseter, Treasure Island, San Francisco,
12 prints of the Federal Building under construction at Treasure Island, San Francisco,
1 print depicting George Creel,
1 print depicting George Creel and others at the Indian exhibit in the Federal Building, Golden Gate International Exposition,
1 print depicting the Thirtieth Infantry holding U.S. flags,
3 prints of a special event,
1 print depicting Frank Murphy, U.S. attorney general, receiving military honors,
4 prints depicting Edgar Bergen, Charles McCarthy, and Chief Big Turnip(?) on sun deck outside George Creel's office, Federal Building, Treasure Island, San Francisco,
1 print of President Franklin D. Roosevelt in a motorcade during his visit to San Francisco(?),
1 print depicting a large group of people at the opening day of the Federal Building(?),
1 print depicting Simon E. Baldwin, governor of Connecticut, in the recreation court of the Federal Building with Joe Gomez, instructor in fly casting,
1 print depicting George Creel with a congressional group,
1 print depicting W. R. Lawson with George Creel in his office,
1 print depicting a group of people observing Bastille Day,
1 print depicting George Creel with Herbert B. Maw(?), governor of Utah,
1 print depicting a number of people riding horses with flags in their hands,
1 print of a Fourth of July parade,
1 print depicting George Creel with Frank Murphy and J. Edgar Hoover on sun deck off George Creel's office,
1 print of Memorial Day ceremonies,
3 prints of the Maharaja of Kapurthala and his son, Amerjit Singh,
1 print depicting George Creel with Rene d'Harnoncourt and Mr. and Mrs. Lewis O. Barrows,
5 prints of George Creel's office in the Federal Building, Treasure Island, San Francisco,
1 print of George Creel,
1 print of Alice Rosseter Creel,
2 prints of George Creel,
11 negatives,
